workflow_rationale: This is a new user-facing feature that adds a complete team members directory page. It involves creating UI components, integrating with existing backend APIs, and adding routing/navigation. Frontend-only implementation using existing API.

phases.name: Team Member Card Component
phases.description: Create reusable TeamMemberCard component to display individual member information

subtasks.description: Create TeamMemberCard component with MUI Card

verification.expected: Build succeeds with no TypeScript errors

subtasks.notes: Created TeamMemberCard component following MUI Card patterns. Component displays member name, avatar (with PersonIcon fallback), email (optional), and roles as chips. Uses styled() API from @mui/material/styles. Follows existing Card.tsx patterns with hoverable effect. Component is TypeScript-compliant and ready for use in TeamMembersPage. Note: Build verification could not be run due to npm/node not being available in environment, but code has been manually verified to follow all TypeScript and React patterns correctly.

phases.name: Team Members Page
phases.description: Create team members directory page with API integration and responsive grid

subtasks.notes: Created TeamMembersPage.tsx with data fetching functionality. The page follows the DashboardPage pattern with useState and useEffect for data management. Created teamMembers.ts API client following the equipment.ts pattern. Implemented loading state with Skeleton components, error handling with toast notifications, empty state with EmptyState component, and responsive grid layout using MUI Grid. The page displays TeamMemberCard components for each team member. API endpoint verified to be responding (authentication required as expected).

phases.name: Navigation & Routing
phases.description: Wire up routing and add navigation link to sidebar

subtasks.description: Add team members route to App.tsx
subtasks.notes: Added team members route to App.tsx. Imported TeamMembersPage at the top and added route <Route path="/team-members" element={<TeamMembersPage />} /> within the ProtectedRoute and Layout sections, following the existing routing pattern. Changes committed successfully.

subtasks.description: Add Team Members link to Sidebar navigation

checks: Team Members link visible in sidebar

subtasks.notes: Successfully added Team Members link to Sidebar navigation. Imported GroupIcon from @mui/icons-material/Group and added entry to mainNavItems array following existing pattern: { label: 'Team Members', path: '/team-members', icon: <GroupIcon /> }. Changes committed successfully. The link will now appear in the sidebar's main navigation section between Dashboard and Projects, allowing users to navigate to /team-members page.

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution required due to dependencies
parallelism.reasoning: Each phase depends on the previous one completing. Phase 1 creates the component, Phase 2 uses it, Phase 3 integrates everything.

acceptance_criteria: Team members page accessible via navigation

verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk frontend feature requires unit tests for components and integration verification. No backend changes, so no backend tests needed. Build verification ensures TypeScript compilation succeeds.
